title: French elections: More than 210 candidates have withdrawn from the second round
summary: Le Monde has counted 218 candidates who have dropped out of the second round, most of them to help beat the far right. This provisional count, based on candidates' statements, is likely to evolve. The final list of candidates will be published on Wednesday.

title: French elections: Far right rules out withdrawing candidates ahead of second round
summary: The Rassemblement National's strategy aims to mock the other blocs' use of candidate withdrawals to prevent the election of far-right MPs. Despite this, the RN is confident that an absolute majority is still within reach.

title: French PM Attal sets aside criticism of left in 'fight' against far right
summary: After his bloc failed in the first round of the parliamentary elections, Gabriel Attal proposed building a new coalition of the right, left and center against the far right, whose rise to power he described as 'chilling.'

title: How Macron is preparing for 'cohabitation' with the far right
summary: Even before the French cast their final votes in the elections, the president began planning in case he has to share power with the Rassemblement National. He is speeding up key appointments while he still has control of the government.

title: Le Pen accuses Macron of 'administrative coup d'état' as he speeds up appointments
summary: The president approved a series of appointments at the last Council of Ministers. The far-right Rassemblement National leader said the move was designed to 'prevent Jordan Bardella from governing the country as he wishes.'

title: 'Inaudible' Macron faces cacophony in his own camp ahead of election's second round
summary: The French president castigated 'any form of disunity' but did not settle disagreements within his coalition on how to best block the far right and what to do after the elections, when he will be deprived of a majority.

title: Yaroslav Nimets, Ukrainian prisoner and volunteer soldier: 'We understand very clearly where we're going'
summary: More than 5,500 detainees have come forward since May 17, when the law allowing prisoners to join the trenches of eastern and southern Ukraine came into force. 'Le Monde' spoke to several of them to find out why.

title: Supreme Court hands Trump big win on presidential immunity
summary: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson, who opposed the decision, accused the Court's conservative majority of planting 'the seeds of absolute power' for presidents. Joe Biden denounced a 'dangerous precedent,' as the threat of a January 6 trial before the November election receded.

title: In Hong Kong, the gradual erosion of the rule of law
summary: The credibility and reputation of Hong Kong's judicial system have been severely shaken by the verdict handed down at the end of May in the historic political trial of the '47.' They have been so much shaken that two British judges sitting on Hong Kong's Court of Final Appeal have announced their resignation, without even waiting for the outcome of the appeal process.

title: Euro 2024: Turkey beats Austria 2-1 to advance to quarterfinal against the Netherlands
summary: Turkish player Merih Demiral opened the scoring after less than a minute on Tuesday and netted again in the second half to set up a clash against the Netherlands in Berlin on Saturday. The Dutch team earlier reached its first European Championship quarterfinal in 16 years with a 3-0 win over Romania.

title: The cheerful campaign of Ed Davey, leader of the UK Liberal Democrats
summary: In a swimsuit in the Thames, on a giant slide or on a roller coaster, the 58-year-old MP has attempted to win over the British public in an offbeat style, ahead of the July 4 general election.

title: Category 5 Hurricane Beryl kills 5, hurtles toward  Jamaica
summary: The storm is causing widespread destruction in a deadly sweep across the southeastern Caribbean.

title: Three dead after Mauritania riots amid post-election tension
summary: Two people died in custody and a third died later in hospital, the government said on Tuesday. The unrest took place against a tense backdrop after final provisional election results announced on Monday gave the incumbent President a comfortable victory in Saturday's presidential poll.

title: Pogacar wins stage four to reclaim Tour de France lead
summary: The two-time former champion soloed to victory in stage four of the cycling race.

title: Hungary's Orbán makes first visit to Ukraine since start of war
summary: The Hungarian prime minister arrived in Kyiv on Tuesday to talk with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, marking his first visit to the wartorn country since the start of Russia's invasion.

title: Dutch king swears in a new government seven months after far right won elections
summary: Dick Schoof, former head of the Dutch intelligence agency and counterterrorism office, is the new prime minister.

title: Nearly 100 killed in stampede at India religious gathering
summary: Crowds had gathered to celebrate the Hindu deity Shiva in the city of Hathras, located some 140 kilometers southeast of New Delhi. Official reports reported the death toll had reached 97 on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Lloyd Doggett becomes first Democratic Congress member to call for Biden to step down as party nominee
summary: Representative Doggett of Texas said in a statement Tuesday that Biden should 'make the painful and difficult decision to withdraw.'

title: Israel frees director of Gaza hospital, sparking internal political backlash
summary: The Palestinian doctor, who said he was subjected to 'severe torture' during his detention, was released after the Shin Bet confirmed that he met the criteria for release. Other sources indicate that the release of dozens of prisoners was due in part to a lack of space in Israeli prisons.

title: Between the RN and Algeria, the risk of a showdown
summary: The coming to power of Marine Le Pen's party, whose origins are closely linked to French Algeria, would rattle the relationship between Paris and Algiers.

title: Russian society was described as being 'in a perpetual state of siege' by the Marquis de Custine, as far back as 1839
summary: In the 19th century, Marquis Astolphe de Custine cast a critical but honest eye on Russia. For Benoît Vitkine, 'Le Monde' correspondent in Moscow for five years, the writer's observations continue to offer a key to understanding the country he recently left.

title: Michael Jackson, 'the country's child' celebrated in a Côte d'Ivoire village
summary: Krindjabo, the capital of the Sanwi kingdom where the former 'King of Pop' had ancestors, has invited an impersonator for the 15th anniversary of his death and harbors great ambitions to memorialize the American superstar.

title: French elections: Singer Aya Nakamura calls to vote against the far right
summary: The most listened to French-speaking artist in the world called for a vote 'against the only extreme to be condemned because there is only one.'

title: 'Chinatown' writer Robert Towne dies aged 89
summary: The Oscar-winning screenplay writer was a leading figure of the 1970s New Hollywood movement. Hs work on 'Chinatown' became a model of the art form and helped define the jaded allure of his native Los Angeles.

title: Sauron's wink in the piranha world
summary: A new species of herbivore piranha has been identified in Brazil's Xingu River, a tributary of the Amazon. Researchers have named this little fish 'Myloplus sauron.'

title: French elections: 'The Fifth Republic in uncharted territory'
summary: The new situation in the first round of elections to the Assemblée Nationale is introducing instability unseen since 1958, analyzes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: French elections: 'It's not the first time Macron opportunely remembers about the republican front'
summary: Ahead of Sunday's second round of snap elections, the French president called for 'not a single vote' to go to the far right. But Macron hasn't always been forthcoming about this 'republican front,' notes political columnist Solenn de Royer.

title: Trump's sentencing in trial for secret payments to porn star postponed until September
summary: This postponement is the first concrete effect of the US Supreme Court's decision to extend the former president's immunity.

title: China rainstorms: Nearly a quarter of a million people evacuated
summary: Torrential rainfall in previous days had already caused flooding, particularly in the southern province of Guangdong, where at least 38 people lost their lives.

title: France's BFMTV news channel bought by shipping magnate
summary: Rodolphe Saadé's CMA CGM Group announced the surprise buy-out of Altice Media, which owns BFMTV and the RMC radio station, in March for €1.55 billion

title: French elections: What the 221 candidate withdrawals tell us about the shape of the second round
summary: Calls for candidates not to stand in races where the RN could win have been complied with by almost everyone on the left, and to a lesser extent by Macron supporters.

title: French elections: Why there won't be a debate between the two rounds
summary: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal and far-right leader Jordan Bardella were due to face a left-wing representative, but profound disagreement over who to choose prevented the program from going ahead.

title: French elections: Sharp rise in voter turnout mostly benefited the far right and Macron's camp
summary: In the first round of snap parliamentary elections on June 30, the president's coalition of parties attracted 2.8 million more votes than in the June 9 European elections, as did the Rassemblement National and its allies. The left, on the other hand, gained only 1.2 million votes.

title: Biden challenged in polls, by fellow Democrats after Trump debate debacle
summary: A member of Congress called on US President Joe Biden to withdraw on Tuesday, after post-debate polls showed VP Kamala Harris with the best chance of beating Donald Trump. The president's camp remains in denial.

title: Hurricane Beryl, an extraordinary phenomenon wreaking havoc in the Caribbean
summary: This unusually violent storm has claimed seven lives in the southeast of the Caribbean archipelago and is threatening Jamaica.

title: French Catholic holy site of Lourdes to no longer light up mosaics by accused priest
summary: Marko Rupnik, an artist priest with mosaics in churches worldwide, is under investigation for psychological and sexual violence on some 20 women, after the Pope lifted the statute of limitations on the offenses.

title: French elections: Only far right can win absolute majority, warns PM Attal
summary: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal called on voters to hold their nose and back any candidate capable of beating the Rassemblement National.

title: Orban visits Ukraine for the first time since Russia's invasion
summary: Hungary's prime minister, known for his pro-Russian stance, called on Ukraine to consider a 'ceasefire' on Tuesday just one day after Hungary took over the rotating presidency of the Council of the European Union.

title: French elections: Far right embarrassed by candidate's racist remarks about dual nationals
summary: Daniel Grenon, a far-right Rassemblement National candidate running for re-election, said during a debate that French citizens of North African origin should not be appointed as ministers. His party claims it was an 'erroneous' quote, though it was confirmed via a recording.

title: UK general election: Rishi Sunak gets surprise support from Boris Johnson as vote looms
summary: The ousted scandal-ridden former prime minister made a surprise show of support for the incumbent British leader ahead of general elections on July 4.

title: French prosecutors request rape charges against film director Jacquot
summary: The prosecutors requested that Benoît Jacquot be charged with raping actors Isild Le Besco and Julia Roy. Jacquot has denied all accusations.

title: Netherlands: Fragile coalition between far right and right takes power
summary: The populist Geert Wilders had to give up the prime minister's post but hopes to make his mark on a government made up in part of technocrats.

title: French elections: Could there be an anti-RN governing coalition, from the Greens to the right?
summary: Should the far right fall short of an absolute majority, Prime Minister Gabriel Attal floated the idea of building an unprecedented coalition in the history of France's Fifth Republic, to avoid gridlock.
